009package com.weather.sdk.exception;
010
011/**
012 * Exception thrown when the OpenWeatherAPI rate limit is exceeded.
013 *
014 * <p>This exception is thrown when:
015 *
016 * <ul>
017 *   <li>The API key has exceeded its rate limit (60 calls per minute for free tier)
018 *   <li>The request frequency is too high for the current API key
019 *   <li>The application is making requests too quickly
020 *   <li>The API key has reached its daily/monthly quota limit
021 * </ul>
022 *
023 * <h2>Error Code</h2>
024 *
025 * <p>Error code: {@value #ERROR_CODE}
026 *
027 * <h2>Rate Limits</h2>
028 *
029 * <ul>
030 *   <li><strong>Free Tier:</strong> 60 calls per minute, 1,000,000 calls per month
031 *   <li><strong>Paid Tiers:</strong> Higher limits depending on subscription level
032 *   <li><strong>Enterprise:</strong> Custom rate limits
033 * </ul>
034 *
035 * <h2>Recovery Actions</h2>
036 *
037 * <ul>
038 *   <li>Implement exponential backoff strategy
039 *   <li>Cache weather data to reduce API calls
040 *   <li>Consider upgrading to a higher tier API plan
041 *   <li>Implement request queuing to spread calls over time
042 *   <li>Use batch requests where possible
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <h2>Retry Strategy</h2>
046 *
047 * <p>The SDK implements automatic retry logic for rate limit exceptions:
048 *
049 * <ul>
050 *   <li>Exponential backoff with jitter (500ms base, 2x multiplier)
051 *   <li>Maximum 3 retry attempts
052 *   <li>Logs retry attempts at WARN level
053 * </ul>
054 *
055 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
056 *
057 * <h3>Handling Rate Limit Exceptions</h3>
058 *
059 * <pre>
060 * try {
061 *   WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("London");
062 * } catch (RateLimitException e) {
063 *   logger.warn("Rate limit exceeded: {}", e.getMessage());
064 *
065 *   // Implement exponential backoff
066 *   try {
067 *     Thread.sleep(calculateBackoffDelay(e.getRetryAfterSeconds()));
068 *     WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("London");
069 *   } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
070 *     Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
071 *     throw new RuntimeException("Interrupted during backoff", ie);
072 *   }
073 * }
074 * </pre>
075 *
076 * <h3>Proactive Rate Limit Management</h3>
077 *
078 * <pre>
079 * public class RateLimitManager {
080 *   private final RateLimiter limiter = RateLimiter.create(50.0); // 50 calls per minute
081 *
082 *   public WeatherData getWeatherWithRateLimit(String city) throws WeatherSDKException {
083 *     limiter.acquire(); // Blocks until permit available
084 *     return sdk.getWeather(city);
085 *   }
086 * }
087 * </pre>
088 *
089 * @since 1.0.0
090 * @see com.weather.sdk.WeatherSDK#getWeather(String)
091 * @see com.weather.sdk.exception.WeatherSDKException
092 */
093public class RateLimitException extends WeatherSDKException {
094
095  /** Serial version UID for serialization compatibility. */
096  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
097
098  /** Error code for rate limit exceeded issues. */
099  public static final String ERROR_CODE = "RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED";
100
101  /** One minute in seconds. */
102  private static final int MINUTE_60_SEC = 60;
103
104  /** One hour in seconds. */
105  private static final int HOUR_3600_SEC = 3600;
106
107  /** The number of seconds to wait before making another request. */
108  private final Integer retryAfterSeconds;
109
110  /**
111   * Constructs a new RateLimitException with the specified message.
112   *
113   * @param message the detail message explaining the rate limit issue. Must not be null.
114   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
115   */
116  public RateLimitException(final String message) {
117    super(ERROR_CODE, message);
118    this.retryAfterSeconds = null;
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Constructs a new RateLimitException with the specified message and retry-after time.
123   *
124   * @param message the detail message explaining the rate limit issue. Must not be null.
125   * @param retryAfterSeconds the number of seconds to wait before making another request. May be
126   *     null if not provided by the API.
127   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
128   */
129  public RateLimitException(final String message, final Integer retryAfterSeconds) {
130    super(ERROR_CODE, message);
131    this.retryAfterSeconds = retryAfterSeconds;
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Constructs a new RateLimitException with the specified message, retry-after time, and cause.
136   *
137   * @param message the detail message explaining the rate limit issue. Must not be null.
138   * @param retryAfterSeconds the number of seconds to wait before making another request. May be
139   *     null if not provided by the API.
140   * @param cause the underlying cause of the rate limit issue. May be null.
141   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
142   */
143  public RateLimitException(
144      final String message, final Integer retryAfterSeconds, final Throwable cause) {
145    super(ERROR_CODE, message, cause);
146    this.retryAfterSeconds = retryAfterSeconds;
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Returns the number of seconds to wait before making another request.
151   *
152   * @return the retry-after time in seconds, or null if not provided
153   */
154  public Integer getRetryAfterSeconds() {
155    return retryAfterSeconds;
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Returns the recommended wait time in milliseconds.
160   *
161   * @return the retry-after time in milliseconds, or a default 60000ms (1 minute) if null
162   */
163  public long getRetryAfterMillis() {
164    return retryAfterSeconds != null ? retryAfterSeconds * 1000L : 60_000L;
165  }
166
167  /**
168   * Calculates a recommended backoff delay using exponential backoff with jitter.
169   *
170   * @param attempt the current retry attempt number (1-based)
171   * @return the backoff delay in milliseconds
172   */
173  public long calculateBackoffDelay(final int attempt) {
174    final long result;
175    if (retryAfterSeconds != null) {
176      // Use the API-provided retry-after time if available
177      result = getRetryAfterMillis();
178    } else {
179      // Exponential backoff: base 500ms, max 32 seconds
180      final long baseDelay = 500L;
181      final long maxDelay = 32_000L;
182      final long delay = Math.min(baseDelay * (1L << (attempt - 1)), maxDelay);
183
184      // Add jitter (±25% random variation)
185      final double jitter = 0.75 + (Math.random() * 0.5);
186      result = (long) (delay * jitter);
187    }
188    return result;
189  }
190
191  /**
192   * Returns a human-readable description of when the rate limit will reset.
193   *
194   * @return a description of the reset time, or null if unknown
195   */
196  public String getResetTimeDescription() {
197    final String result;
198    if (retryAfterSeconds == null) {
199      result = null;
200    } else if (retryAfterSeconds < MINUTE_60_SEC) {
201      result = retryAfterSeconds + " seconds";
202    } else if (retryAfterSeconds < HOUR_3600_SEC) {
203      result = (retryAfterSeconds / 60) + " minutes";
204    } else {
205      result = (retryAfterSeconds / 3600) + " hours";
206    }
207    return result;
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Returns the exception type description.
212   *
213   * @return "Rate Limit Exceeded Error"
214   */
215  @Override
216  public String getExceptionType() {
217    return "Rate Limit Exceeded Error";
218  }
219}
